title: stevenjohnstone
author: stevenjohnstone
content: hi guys im 64 years old and i want to learn how to use bitcoin email me at stevenjohnstone@mail.com with any tips or whatever i need to learn so i can make money these days

comments.author: mocacinno
comments.body: I don't know if you're for real... But if you are: you just posted a big advertisement for scammers...Personally, i'd disregard all mails arriving at that address from now on cause everybody looking for an easy victim will be mailing you.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: Quote from: mocacinno on June 22, 2023, 11:40:19 AMI don't know if you're for real... But if you are: you just posted a big advertisement for scammers...Personally, i'd disregard all mails arriving at that address from now on cause everybody looking for an easy victim will be mailing you.There is nothing more tht he is doing, he is only inviting scammers and that is just it. Everything about bitcoin discussion should be done openly on this forum. Take time to learn about bitcoin yourself if you do not want anyone to scam you. Start to read about bitcoin paper online. Paper like this ones:https://www.forbes.com/advisor/investing/cryptocurrency/what-is-bitcoin/https://www.investopedia.com/terms/b/bitcoin.asp

comments.author: stevenjohnstone
comments.body: Quote from: mocacinno on June 22, 2023, 11:40:19 AMI don't know if you're for real... But if you are: you just posted a big advertisement for scammers...Personally, i'd disregard all mails arriving at that address from now on cause everybody looking for an easy victim will be mailing you.im just learning the teconology of bitcoin and trying to learn with the forum if you can help me please email me at stevenjohnstone@mail.com I dont know how to access forums

comments.author: Latviand
comments.body: @mocacinno is right, you just put a big target on your back by posting your email in a public forum. Also, I assume that you are technology knowledgeable so you should've considered learning about private message in the forum, that way, you can still talk to people and at the same time safely give your email to a person if you think they are trustworthy enough. Pretty cool that you're 64 and knows how to navigate online forums, if you're a real deal then that's pretty awesome. On the other hand though, it's kind of fishy that you give your email away knowing that scammers will use that to get to you, either you are some scammer too that plans to promote something through email correspondence or you plan to send some trojan to the people who will contact you through your email, I hope my suspicion will be proven as nothing but suspicion.Quote from: stevenjohnstone on June 22, 2023, 11:47:07 AMim just learning the teconology of bitcoin and trying to learn with the forum if you can help me please email me at stevenjohnstone@mail.com I dont know how to access forumsIf you want to learn about the forum, you can probably have a good time browsing the Beginners & Help board.Here's the link to that board, just click it: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=39.0

comments.author: Hyphen(-)
comments.body: Quote from: stevenjohnstone on June 22, 2023, 11:47:07 AMim just learning the teconology of bitcoin and trying to learn with the forum if you can help me please email me at stevenjohnstone@mail.com I dont know how to access forumsThere is no need to send you tips via mail; all the necessary tips you will need will be provided for you here in the forum.First of all, this forum gives you a chance to ask as many questions as possible about anything you would like to know about Bitcoin; therefore, this forum can be your learning environment because I am sure all you need will be provided to you here in this wonderful forum.Moreover, learnmeabitcoin.com is a book that explains the basics and all you will need to know about Bitcoin. You can go through it, and if you have any questions, you can come to the forum for more clarification.

comments.author: stevenjohnstone
comments.body: I asked for help on reddit and someone is helping me in the chat please someone email me at stevenjohnstone@mail.com I will no longer be using the forum

comments.author: pmemorex
comments.body: Yes i can help me my email pmemorex2016@gmail.com

comments.author: Taskford
comments.body: Quote from: stevenjohnstone on June 22, 2023, 11:38:44 AMhi guys im 64 years old and i want to learn how to use bitcoin email me at stevenjohnstone@mail.com with any tips or whatever i need to learn so i can make money these daysDon't get any tips coming from people randomly much better if you erase your private mail since anyone could see that and might you will be a target of scams since you are new to bitcoin. Just post all your questions here since this is the safe place where you can ask any information for free. There would be a lot of forum users will answer your questions so stop dealing using email thing since its kinda risky especially we are dealing with crypto.

comments.author: mendace
comments.body: The most wrong way to present yourself on the forum and above all that reeks of scam.  Why on earth would I send you an email figuring out my address.  It's better if you leave the forum, people like you make me so sorry and will never have my compassion.  Report this post to the admins.

comments.author: sokani
comments.body: Quote from: mendace on June 22, 2023, 12:33:03 PMThe most wrong way to present yourself on the forum and above all that reeks of scam.  Why on earth would I send you an email figuring out my address.  It's better if you leave the forum, people like you make me so sorry and will never have my compassion.  Report this post to the admins.Don't rule out the possibility that the op might have his/her own ulterior motives because I don't see how one would want to learn Bitcoin and would want tips to be forwarded to the email address when you have a forum like this with the brightest of minds and industry veterans where you have the opportunity to get first hand knowledge and information about Bitcoin and also get to ask whatever questions you need to ask. Personally, I might be wrong but won't take the op seriously as I feel he/she is up to something.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: Quote from: stevenjohnstone on June 22, 2023, 11:38:44 AMhi guys im 64 years old and i want to learn how to use bitcoin email me at stevenjohnstone@mail.com with any tips or whatever i need to learn so i can make money these daysOP at first I will welcome you to this platform and secondly, I'll correct your errors;1. As a newbie, your can ask questions of inquiries as to how things works on this platform here. There you would see some questions asked by some newbies and they got replies and I believe your questions are not different from them. There are also response there too which you can read for better understanding.2. Dropping your email address requesting for tips through this platform is very wrong which I believe you must have been called to order as it exposes one to possible scam and hack attempt. This act of yours looks suspicious as you are a newbie with no activities and reputation for a backup. You can do your own research rather than waiting for email tips as this would keep you more sensitive on the case matter.Lastly, I would advise you edit your post removing your email address as it is not necessary for the kind of post made here by you. Such email is not welcoming and others might have risk.

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: Why OP has to keep on spamming his email for someone to contact him and teach him about Bitcoin? It's because there is probably some ill intent and plan of his on who's ever gullible enough to teach him about Bitcoin. Isn't it hard to access the forum if he already did some posts already and also made this thread alone? It's likely that if someone contacts him, there's already some sort of scripted replies that he'll make for that guy to get into his scheme. Because if I'm a newbie and I do really want to learn about Bitcoin, the first thing that I'll search is through google and that's a vast of information for most newbies. And if still I am not satisfied yet, the next website that I'll go is YouTube and search those videos about bitcoin for beginners.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Quote from: stevenjohnstone on June 22, 2023, 11:38:44 AMhi guys im 64 years old and i want to learn how to use bitcoin email me at stevenjohnstone@mail.com with any tips or whatever i need to learn so i can make money these daysAnother eccentric decided that someone needed him here. No matter how many years you accrue to yourself here, on our forum there are people older than you who are quite independent and do not write nonsense. If you have a desire, then you are the person concerned; therefore, you yourself must look for what interests you.I hope you understand. Take action.

comments.author: adpinbr
comments.body: Yes I agree on what other said, I don’t know if you are for real.Maybe you have heard of bitcoin somewhere and you think is just easy way to make money.You will have to understand and study very well, it may not be easy as you think.Please also be aware of scammers

comments.author: SOKO-DEKE
comments.body: Quote from: stevenjohnstone on June 22, 2023, 11:38:44 AMhi guys im 64 years old and i want to learn how to use bitcoin email me at stevenjohnstone@mail.com with any tips or whatever i need to learn so i can make money these daysI don't really understand why you needed someone to email you first before you started learning about Bitcoin. If you truly want to learn and you don't have any hidden plans, you should learn it publicly so other newbies members can also be following you to learn at the same time you are learning it. The Bitcointalk forum is a place where everyone comes to learn or contribute by helping others with answers or suggestions they may have, so it is seen as a chat platform where things about Bitcoin and cryptocurrency in general are discussing. If this forum is where everyone can learn, I think any discussion should be discuss publicly. and gain, why did you decide people to message you in email, why not forum private messages? This really looks very dangerous.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: Quote from: mocacinno on June 22, 2023, 11:40:19 AM you just posted a big advertisement for scammers...Personally, OP, @mocacinno is very correct about that 👆. The fact that you are old and new makes you more susceptible to receiving a lot of spam mail from scammers trying to convince you what to do and what not to Do.I would suggest that you be careful not to trust all the emails you are going to receive. By the way, I don't know if you are real about your age or not, but if you are, since you already have the zeal to learn about Bitcoin, I don't think you would be limited by your age to read very well and also watch some videos. which I will suggest you read or see the contents below, it was suggested to me by a friend here, and it really did help me.Jameson Lopp Bitcoin ResourcesBitcoin for Beginners by Andreas Antonopoulos

comments.author: Obari
comments.body: Quote from: mocacinno on June 22, 2023, 11:40:19 AMI don't know if you're for real... But if you are: you just posted a big advertisement for scammers...Personally, i'd disregard all mails arriving at that address from now on cause everybody looking for an easy victim will be mailing you.Are you sure his not even a scammer who trying to get new scope from co scammers like himself?Just my wild thoughts and nothing is impossible  now especially  on the internet, hence we ought to be careful while dealing with  people on the forum  irrespective of your age or rank or even status.But on the second thought, if his claims are actually genuine, then I agree that 99.9% of emails he might recieve within  this period of time will all be scam and if not careful,  there are alot of pleasing temptations this criminals offer, one might fall victim and might get scam of some reasonable amount of money that you'll  never imagine you could lose to scam.We all have to be very careful with our dealings with cryptocurrencies and if there is anything you'll  want to learn, I think the forum is a great tool to aid it,  provided you make out time for it and YouTube videos are both enough to see you through,  without wanting to have a physical mentor .

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: Quote from: stevenjohnstone on June 22, 2023, 11:38:44 AMhi guys im 64 years old and i want to learn how to use bitcoin email me at stevenjohnstone@mail.com with any tips or whatever i need to learn so i can make money these daysNobody needs to send you an inbox personally to teach you about bitcoins. You joined this forum to learn about bitcoins and you will and learn from everyone here even pointed in the direction to get good materials of only you just ask the question like you have asked this in the beginners and help section of this forum. Apart from you putting yourself up as potential victims to scammers, it also sounds more suspicious than naive that you are putting up your emails in a public place for strangers to contact you.

comments.author: Ever-young
comments.body: Quote from: stevenjohnstone on June 22, 2023, 11:38:44 AMhi guys im 64 years old and i want to learn how to use bitcoin email me at stevenjohnstone@mail.com with any tips or whatever i need to learn so i can make money these daysWhy come to a Bitcoin forum and advertise your personal details ? As if email is not enough you also included your age, what's then stopping you from adding your full name and house address maybe any one who have information about Bitcoin could come directly to your door step and teach you face to face maybe that could even be better than sending it directly to your email. Their is actually no need in dropping your details here. If you need any information they will be drop for you here, this is Bitcoin forum any questions and matter relating to Bitcoin is being discussed here, all you have to do is ask the question and watch the thread filled with responds from different members.
